instance.name: Hippocampal stimulation during temporal lobe seizure
instance.citation: Devergnas, Annaelle (2024) Hippocampal stimulation during temporal lobe seizure (Version draft) [Data set]. DANDI archive. https://dandiarchive.org/dandiset/001054/draft
keywords: temporal lobe seizure, asynchronous stimulation, hippocampal stimulation
instance.description: Four non-human primates were used for this study in two contemporaneous cohorts. One cohort (n=3 hemispheres) was implanted with the Medtronic RC+S stimulation (GIN cohort) and recording system connected to two 4-contact ring electrodes to evaluate three unilateral stimulation patterns: 7 Hz Ring ADMES, 20 Hz Dual Ring, and 125 Hz Dual Ring (analog of clinical stimulation). In an additional cohort (EPC cohort, n=2), two 12-contact segmented electrodes were implanted in the right hippocampus and connected to an externalized recording and stimulation system to allow more flexibility in the stimulation pattern. In this second cohort, 4 variations of stimulation were evaluated (7 Hz Full ADMES, 7 Hz Ring ADMES, 31 Hz Wide Ring, and 31 Hz Dual Ring).
studyTarget: Evaluating ADMES hippocampal stimulation for temporal lobe seizure

measurementTechnique.name: multi electrode extracellular electrophysiology recording technique
